intro: Detandra latifolia, commonly known as the broadleaf detandra, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and other toxic plants. The plant is characterized by its broad, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of fragrant, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink. Detandra latifolia typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. It is often found in moist, well-drained soils in forest understories or along stream banks.
